data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.
data.sentence: The word خَوْفٍ comes from the root خ و ف and is associated with the meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.

data.meanings: To be hungry, empty in the belly, hunger or long for a thing, to desire and long (as though hungering) for a thing.
data.sentence: The word جُوعٍ comes from the root ج و ع and is associated with the meanings: To be hungry, empty in the belly, hunger or long for a thing, to desire and long (as though hungering) for a thing.
